short_description: A dystopian tale of totalitarian control.
long_description: George Orwell's '1984' explores a bleak future where a totalitarian regime, led by Big Brother, controls every aspect of life. Through the story of Winston Smith, it examines themes of surveillance, freedom, and truth.
author: George Orwell

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
short_description: A story of justice and racial inequality.
long_description: Harper Lee's classic novel delves into racial injustice in the American South through the eyes of Scout Finch. Her father, Atticus Finch, defends an innocent Black man accused of a crime, revealing the depths of human empathy and prejudice.
author: Harper Lee

title: The Great Gatsby
short_description: A critique of the American Dream.
long_description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's 'The Great Gatsby' examines the opulence and disillusionment of the Roaring Twenties through the tragic tale of Jay Gatsby's pursuit of love and success.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: Moby-Dick
short_description: A tale of obsession and revenge.
long_description: Herman Melville's 'Moby-Dick' follows Captain Ahab's relentless pursuit of the white whale that maimed him, exploring themes of vengeance, humanity, and the sea's power.
author: Herman Melville

title: Pride and Prejudice
short_description: A romance with wit and critique of society.
long_description: Jane Austen's 'Pride and Prejudice' follows Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates love, class, and societal expectations, offering sharp observations of early 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Catcher in the Rye
short_description: A rebellious teen's journey in New York.
long_description: J.D. Salinger's 'The Catcher in the Rye' tells the story of Holden Caulfield, a disaffected teenager wandering through New York City while grappling with alienation and identity.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: The Hobbit
short_description: A fantasy adventure of a reluctant hero.
long_description: J.R.R. Tolkien's 'The Hobbit' follows Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit thrust into an epic quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug, discovering courage and friendship along the way.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Alchemist
long_description: Paulo Coelho's 'The Alchemist' follows Santiago, a shepherd, on his quest to find treasure, learning profound lessons about following one's dreams and the interconnectedness of life.
author: Paulo Coelho

title: Brave New World
short_description: A dystopian society obsessed with control.
long_description: Aldous Huxley's 'Brave New World' presents a chilling vision of a future where technology, conditioning, and conformity create a superficially perfect but deeply flawed society.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: The Road
long_description: Cormac McCarthy's 'The Road' tells the story of a father and son traveling through a desolate, post-apocalyptic world, exploring themes of survival, love, and hope amidst despair.
author: Cormac McCarthy
